text: Hey guys! Anyone here savvy when it comes to designing HTML emails for Outlook?
HTML emails for most clients, yes

Hey <@U2PDTMH53> the reason I ask is we have a HubSpot customer on the HubSPot Community looking for assistance on styling her email for Outlook. In this case I think she is using a HubSpot template but I advised her that custom HTML was the way to go if she wants more control over how her emails render in different clients
Waiting to hear back from customer, but as this is not my area of expertise would appreciate insights from any of the experts here :slightly_smiling_face:
Ok. I don't know about giving insights, but if I see it, I can probably fix it
Thanks! Asked customer to share her template
Also, you know it's almost impossible to have an email look pixel perfect in email clients :)
Also, I'm specialised on custom HubSpot templates ... so happy to help with any sort of HubSpot templates
<@U26DVNURX> I commented on it. As you mentioned, without seeing their code, no real way to help with their issue. Hopefully what I posted helps

Wondering if anyone has an idea on how to solve my current situation.  I have a loop that goes through the request.contact.list_memberships.  Currently I can only show something IF they are in the list, but I really want to know that it does not match, but I don't know how to do that with hubl loops.
With this loop I just use JS to check to see if the div is there.  If it isn't, then I use JS to display the code I want, but this isn't the most efficient or ideal way to do this
